entries.name: Special
entries: Your hand is considered free even while you are wielding this weapon, but you can't use it to attack if you're wielding another weapon in the same hand.

entries.name: Special
entries: The off-hand end of the weapon deals {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage. You can only benefit from the reach property with one of the two ends within a single turn.

item.name: Estus Flask
entries: This dull emerald flask is treasured by adventurers everywhere. It constantly gives out warmth, regardless of the surrounding temperature, and it contains the precious Estus, a liquid substance with miraculous healing properties.

When placed in a flame, hearth, or other similar source of flame it begins to slowly fill with a vibrant orange liquid. After 1 hour the flask is filled completely. It may be removed from the fire safely as it is never more than warm to the touch.

Using an action, any creature may drink the Estus to spend as many of their Hit Dice as possible, up to a maximum of half the creature's level, to regain a number of hit points equal to {@dice 1d4+1} times the number of Hit Dice spent. A creature that is attuned to this item multiplies the hit dice spent by their Hit Die value + their Constitution modifier instead.
In order to attune to this item you first need to drink its contents, and then you must wait until the second dawn since you drank it.

Regardless of attunement, drinking the contents of the flask provides enough sustenance and water for the day, and drinking more than one flask during the same day is likely to cause illness from overeating.
A creature that falls unconscious while attuned to this item loses attunement to it.

entries.name: Double
entries: This weapon can be wielded in two hands and it is considered a pair of light weapons when you do. You can choose which end of the weapon to attack with if you wield it one-handed.
